data.sentence: The word وَهُوَ comes from the root ه و and is associated with the meanings: huwa = He (pronoun. masculine 3rd. sing.)

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word الْعَلِيمُ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبَّكَ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
data.sentence: The word بَيْنَهُمْ comes from the root ب ي ن and is associated with the meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness

data.meanings: mighty/potent/powerful/strong, noble/honourable/glorious, resisted/withstood, invincible, overcome (e.g. in argument), exalt, prevail, highly esteemed, precious, glory, vanity, excellent, proud and hard manner, stern.. uzza - name of an idol of the pagan Arabs regarded by them as God's daughter.. . 'Azza (prf. 3rd. m. sing. asim. V): Prevailed.. 'Azzaznaa (prf. 1st. pl. II): We strengthened.. Tu'izzu (impf. 2nd. m. pl. II): thou honour, confer honour and dignity.. 'Izzan (v. n.): source of strength.. 'Izzatun (v. n.): vain pride, false prestige or sense of self respect, might honour, power.. Al-Aziizun (act. pic. m. sing.): All-Mighty, One of the names of Allah, Unassailable, invincible, powerful in evidences and arguments, strong, mighty, heavy (with 'alaa: tell hard upon).. A'azzu (elative): more powerful, that occupies stronger and more respectable position.. A'izzatan (n. pl.): most respectable and powerful, its sing. is 'Aziiyun.
data.sentence: The word الْعَزِيزُ comes from the root ع ز ز and is associated with the meanings: mighty/potent/powerful/strong, noble/honourable/glorious, resisted/withstood, invincible, overcome (e.g. in argument), exalt, prevail, highly esteemed, precious, glory, vanity, excellent, proud and hard manner, stern.. uzza - name of an idol of the pagan Arabs regarded by them as God's daughter.. . 'Azza (prf. 3rd. m. sing. asim. V): Prevailed.. 'Azzaznaa (prf. 1st. pl. II): We strengthened.. Tu'izzu (impf. 2nd. m. pl. II): thou honour, confer honour and dignity.. 'Izzan (v. n.): source of strength.. 'Izzatun (v. n.): vain pride, false prestige or sense of self respect, might honour, power.. Al-Aziizun (act. pic. m. sing.): All-Mighty, One of the names of Allah, Unassailable, invincible, powerful in evidences and arguments, strong, mighty, heavy (with 'alaa: tell hard upon).. A'azzu (elative): more powerful, that occupies stronger and more respectable position.. A'izzatan (n. pl.): most respectable and powerful, its sing. is 'Aziiyun.

data.sentence: The word يَقْضِي comes from the root ق ض ي and is associated with the meanings: to finish entirely by word/deed, decreed/ordained/pronounced/decide judicially, pass a sentence, create, bring to an end, attained/obtained/accomplished/satisfied, execute, settle, discharge, to make known, reveal.

data.meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
data.sentence: The word بِحُكْمِهِ comes from the root ح ك م and is associated with the meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
